examples: I think this is an opportune time to discuss our plans for the future.

examples: Have you read the new company doctrine?

I hear you. It's been a tough week for everyone. What do you need to do to relax?
strenuous.synonyms: arduous, demanding, exhausting, laborious, onerous, taxing, toilsome.

examples: I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed after this strenuous day at work.
I understand, it's been a long and difficult day. Why don't you take a break and relax?
This project has been so laborious. I don't think I can finish it in time.
I understand. Why don't we split the work and try to finish it together? That way it won't be so tedious.
This project is really laborious. I'm not sure I can finish it on time.
I understand. It's a lot of work, but if we break it down into smaller tasks, it should be easier to manage.
This restaurant has a really rustic feel to it.
Yeah, it's really cozy. I love the wooden furniture and the warm colors.
rustic.meaning: 乡村的, 地方的, 乡土的

examples: What do you think of this rustic kitchen design?
I love it! The rustic style gives it a cozy and homey feel.
I'm thinking of decorating my home in a rustic style. What do you think?
I think that's a great idea! Rustic decor is cozy and charming. It would be perfect for your home.
I'm sorry, I can't do that. It's too much of a risk.
But why? I'm being very insistent about this.
I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to be insistent about this. We need to discuss this issue further.
Alright, I understand. What would you like to talk about?
I'm sorry, but I can't agree to your request. I'm afraid I'm going to have to be insistent on this one.
What do you mean? Why are you so insistent on this?
Because I think it's the best decision for the company. I'm not going to budge on this one.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to be so impertinent.
It's okay, don't worry about it.
I'm sorry, I don't understand why you're being so impertinent.
I'm simply trying to make a point.
I'm sorry, but I can't help you with that. It's really quite impertinent of you to ask.
What do you mean?
I mean that it was not appropriate for you to ask me for that kind of help. It was out of line.
I'm really impressed by the rigor you put into your work.
Thank you! I believe that hard work and dedication are essential for success.
We need to ensure that our team is doing their job with rigor.
Yes, I agree. We should ensure that everyone is working hard and following the process with diligence and care.
We need to ensure that our team is working with the utmost rigor on this project.
Absolutely, I'll make sure that everyone is working diligently and following the standards.
I think it's very inappropriate for you to insinuate that I'm not doing my job properly.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to imply anything like that. I was just trying to point out that there might be a better way of doing things.
I don't think you should insinuate that I'm not doing my job correctly.
I didn't mean to imply anything, I'm sorry.
I don't think you should be insinuating that I'm not doing my job properly.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to insinuate anything.
We need to act quickly, the deadline is imminent!
I understand, we have to make sure we finish this project before it's too late.
I'm worried about the imminent deadline for the project.
Yes, it's coming up fast. We need to make sure we're on track.
We need to finish this project before the deadline. The deadline is imminent!
Yes, we have to work quickly and efficiently. We don't have much time left!
imminent.synonyms: impending, impending, impending, impending, impending, near, close.

examples: Have you heard about the atrocity that happened in Syria?
Yes, it's a terrible situation. It's an absolute atrocity that innocent people have to suffer like this.
Can you believe the atrocity of what happened in that village?
No, it's truly shocking. I can't believe how many people were affected by it.
Have you heard of the recent atrocity in the Middle East?
Yes, it's a horrible situation.
Do you think it's plausible that we can finish this project by the end of the week?
I believe it's possible. We should be able to make it happen if we put in the extra effort.
Do you think it's plausible to launch our new product in the next month?
It's certainly possible, but I think it's unlikely given the amount of work that needs to be done.
Do you think it's plausible that we can finish this project by the end of the week?
I think it's possible, but it might be a bit of a stretch. We'll have to work hard to make it happen.
We really need to come up with a plan to thwart our competitors.
Absolutely, we can't let them get ahead of us.
thwart.synonyms: defeat, frustrate, hinder, impede, obstruct, prevent

examples: I'm trying to thwart the competition by launching a new product line.
That's a great idea. How are you going to make sure it succeeds?
We need to find a way to thwart our competitors from gaining an edge in the market.
Yes, I agree. We should explore strategies to stay one step ahead of them.
I'm sorry, but I can't approve this frivolous expense.
What do you mean? I thought it was necessary.
frivolous.synonyms: Unnecessary, needless, uncalled-for, gratuitous, unwarranted, unmerited.

examples: I'm not sure if this new project is worth our time. It seems a bit frivolous.
What do you mean by frivolous?
Frivolous means something that is not important or serious, and is a waste of time and energy.
I'm concerned about the frivolous spending we've been doing lately.
I understand your concern. We need to be more careful with our resources.
This dress is so elegant! I love the way it moves.
I agree! The elegance of this dress is undeniable. It's so graceful and refined.
Have you seen the new dress collection at the store? I'm sure you'll love it, it has such elegance!
elegance.synonyms: Oh, I definitely have to check it out! What does the word 'elegance' mean?
elegance.meaning: Elegance means grace and sophistication. It's a way of having a stylish and refined appearance. In Chinese, it's 端庄

examples: I absolutely love the elegance of this dress!
It's absolutely stunning! The elegance of this dress is truly remarkable.
elegance.synonyms: grace, poise, refinement, sophistication, beauty, charm.

examples: I think our strategy is infallible. We can't go wrong with it.
I agree. It's foolproof and unerring. We should get started on it soon.
infallible.synonyms: foolproof, unerring, impeccable, errorless, perfect, unerring.

examples: I'm sure the boss will be pleased with the results of this project, it's been infallible.
Yes, it's been an impeccable job! I'm sure it will be a success.
I'm so glad I have you to rely on. Your advice is always infallible.
Thank you! I'm glad I can help.
